Build Your Psychiatry Career at PrairieCare

PrairieCare has immediate positions available for Child and Adolescent Psychiatrists.

Shawna Evans is available to share more details about the position, our team at PrairieCare, and answer any questions you may have. She can be reached at sevans@prairie-care.com or by calling 651-207-9926.

Our Mission & Values

Our values shape every aspect of our work—and support our mission to provide every individual patient the psychiatric care they truly need.

Respect for the intrinsic value of patients and their families.

Ethical care through scientific understanding and compassionate spirit.

Attentive collaboration with patients, families, and colleagues.

Living these values with patients and each other day by day.

Diversity & Inclusion

PrairieCare welcomes and values the diversity of our patients, families, and teams. We thrive on differences—and seek to develop talented people across a variety of backgrounds, skill sets, and perspectives.

At PrairieCare, your opinion counts. We seek and recognize employee feedback to guide our process, and drive better care outcomes for the many communities we serve.

Why PrairieCare?

PrairieCare is a physician-owned and operated psychiatric healthcare system, with services spanning the full continuum of patient care. Be a part of a purpose-driven team that offers hope and healing to our patients while advancing your unique career!

Help us transform psychiatric care.

Our vision is to transform psychiatric healthcare by providing hope, healing, and better care outcomes for everyone. And that all starts with you. At PrairieCare, you help individuals heal each and every day—improving lives by reshaping mental healthcare for good.

PrairieCare Medical Group is a formal affiliate of the University of Minnesota Medical School and the premiere training site for physicians in the child psychiatry fellowship program. We apply innovative practices not offered in other hospitals to improve the quality of care and patient/family experience.

  • Join a trusted organization with over 700 staff and 200+ clinicians.
  • Grow professionally with multiple opportunities for new roles and fulfilling work.
  • Contribute to a dedicated, diverse team committed to outstanding patient outcomes.
  • Help shape and transform the future of psychiatric healthcare.
“I believe that PrairieCare is able to give individualized care to each patient because of the tremendous amount of teamwork that goes on—not only among professionals on the treatment team, but also with the family.”
– Katie Walker Needs Assessment Counselor
